title: Linear Unida
content:
This type is made with a negative space, should look a continuous lines like a script.

Was designed by Velcy Soutier in 80's.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [linearUnida\_poster.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417183538/http:/typophile.com/files/linearUnida_poster.pdf) | 35.45 KB |
author: adreson

comments.content: I am trying to build some opentype features, with diferent combination.

I like the direction this is going in, but a lot of letter combinations need work.

td, tg, te, rc are slightly off.

kt, av, rv, dw and similar combinations need custom ligatures, but I'm sure you know that.

sw, rv and rp look great.

I think the uppercase M is wrong... shouldn't be squashed.

-matt

Really many ligatures are needed.

thanks Matt!
